intro: Mirabilis gracilis, commonly known as the slender four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Nyctaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink or white flowers that open in the late afternoon. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. The flowers emit a sweet fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths.
